memory.title: Golden hour
memory.feeling: a strange mix of wistfulness knowing that things are going to rapidly change soon yet being tremendously content in the present moment
memory.time: golden hour, a late afternoon at the end of september
memory.place: the grass in front of a harvard university library
memory.event: visiting boston because i'm still deluding myself into thinking my senior year of high school boyfriend wants to stay together

sense.sight: everything is golden and wavering back and forth in the sun, julia is sprawled out on the grass beside me
sense.sound: we're talking over the quiet hum about how it feels like we're in a movie
sense.touch: more grass, a little itchy because grass is never soft in real life
sense.taste: nothing memorable - maybe the remnants of an apple pastry we had at that red-doored cafe in cambridge earlier

memory.title: nando’s
memory.company: Sam and Macs, aka friends toast

sense.sight: bright lights in restaurant, washes of reds and oranges, but that might just be the barbecue and hot sauces I remember

memory.title: Dvorák’s dilemma
memory.place: in the beating heart of the city
memory.company: my friend, panicking, our guide, lost

sense.sight: two beds, a piano, and messy desks

memory.title: wine
memory.company: me, her, a bottle of wine

sense.taste: only the lingering tannin and berries

memory.title: friendship
memory.place: a restaurant in someplace or another

sense.smell: wafts of ramen and pork and rice
sense.taste: A waltz of spicy and salty and umami

memory.title: waiting
memory.feeling: anxious, scared, heart beating too hard too fast, but also a little bit excited
memory.event: waiting for admission decision email from Northwestern

sense.taste: sour and salty taste down my throat

memory.title: stargazing in yosemite
memory.company: two best friends from high school

sense.sight: half dome, bright stars, the milky way, jagged mountains, tall evergreens
sense.sound: a guide talking, crickets, crunching footsteps, some conversation
sense.smell: fresh, crisp nighttime mountain air, evergreens

memory.title: Russian Mule
memory.company: a friend who is leaving for work

sense.sight: a medium-ish crowd of people on a rooftop that faces millennium park
sense.sound: conversations that are and aren’t mine

memory.title: wanna race
memory.event: racing to get to the top of the slide

memory.title: i think you’re really cool too
memory.place: on a bench somewhere near do division st

sense.sound: music from a festival in the distance

memory.title: goodbye
memory.time: early morning during winter break, four hours before his flight back home
memory.event: accepting the fact that we’ll be spending three months apart

sense.sight: him in his forest green turtleneck, blurred from the tears welling up in my eyes

memory.title: weed mom
memory.time: freshman year, spring? after watching ex machina

memory.title: tokyo: day 1
memory.feeling: calm, at peace, slightly jetlagged but with a full heart
memory.time: early morning, but night time in chicago
memory.event: slowly taking in the city, the culture, the people

memory.title: let’s try new things we’ll probably hate anyway
three months later
memory.feeling: excited, anxious, nervous, eager. heart beating real ast
memory.place: getting out on the BART to 16th and Mission

sense.sight: him in the distance, with his signature olive pa agonia jacket
sense.sound: rumbling of the t ai s

memory.title: i hate feeling this way
memory.feeling: tightness in my throat, ache in my heart, sw llen face
memory.event: depressed day full of crying and sleeping

sense.sight: my room dimly lit by th sun peeking past the shades
sense.smell: nothing, blocked by my own gross snot
sense.taste: my tears, aftertaste of the few th n mints that were in my room
